intro: Lepidagathis tenuis, commonly known as the slender lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and clusters of tiny white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
